Event.name: Waver_between_options
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> faces a choice on some <fen>Issue</fen>. They have several <fen>Options</fen> available but keep changing their mind between <fen>Option_1</fen> and <fen>Option_2</fen>. The <fen>Cognizer</fen> may in fact act on their choice at some point but they need not; the <fen>Options</fen> can simply be considered for some time with one being favored for a while and then the other.
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Dave Hayes</fex> <t>wavered</t> <fex name="Issue">about moving to California</fex> <fex name="Explanation">because so many of his friends are in Baltimore</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">He</fex> had <t>wavered</t> <fex name="Options">between half a dozen places</fex>; it was pure chance that he had chosen Marvis Bay.</ex>
<ex>In any event, <fex name="Cognizer">I</fex> <fex name="Time">still</fex> <t>go back and forth</t> <fex name="Issue">on what I want to do</fex>. </ex>
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">He</fex> was firm in his beliefs, <fex name="Time">never</fex> <t>waffled</t> <fex name="Option_1">from one platform</fex> <fex name="Option_2">to another</fex> and was always harshly clear in his stance.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Cognizer">Upper management</fex> <t>waffled</t> <fex name="Issue">whether Fletcher fit their salary structure</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cognizer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who repeatedly changes their mind about which of the <fen>Options</fen> to choose.
<ex><fex name="Cog">I</fex> <t>went back and forth</t> over whether to post it or not, but the fact is that this blog is as much for you as it is for me.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which it logically follows that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps changing their mind about the <fen>Issue</fen>.
<ex>The arbitrator <t>wavered</t> on the issue <fex name="exp">because of the consequences of such a decision on the worker's employment status</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Options
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Options</fen> are the alternative courses of action or the alternative physical or concrete entities that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> can choose from.
<ex>In the late 1890s Carnegie <t>vacillated</t> <fex name="Options">between wanting to dominate the steel industry and wanting to sell out</fex>. </ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps changing their mind between the <fen>Options</fen> that present themselves. <ex>Do they know better than us that our <t>dithering</t> <fex name="Place">at the UN</fex> gave Saddam time to hide, destroy, and shuffle his weapons programs?</ex></def-root >

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE denotes the <fen>Time</fen> interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps changing their mind about which of the <fen>Options</fen> to select.
<ex>Here, however, the Romeros had provided some assurance to Ryan's mother of care, although the court <fex name="Time">later</fex> <t>waffled</t> upon how much supervision was guaranteed</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the selecting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (the same way) and salient characteristics of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> that also affect the action.
<ex>American allies like Italy and Greece <fex name="Manner">nervously</fex> <t>vacillated</t> on their support for the bombing</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Issue
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Issue</fen> is a question about a course of action or a choice between items.
<ex>Editors <t>go back and forth</t> on a daily basis <fex name="Issue">about what gets in the paper</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Option_1
Arg.definition:
<def-root>When there is an explicitly separate construal of the <fen>Options</fen>, <fen>Option_1</fen> is the first-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a from-PP. When it is clear that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> actually acted on their choice, <fen>Option_1</fen> is the alternative they embraced first before pursuing <fen>Option_2</fen>.
<ex>You've <t>waffled</t> <fex name="op1">from one explanation</fex> to another.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Option_2
Arg.definition:
<def-root>When there is an explicitly separate construal of the <fen>Options</fen>, <fen>Option_2</fen> is the second-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a to-PP. When it is clear that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> actually acted on their choice, <fen>Option_2</fen> is the alternative they embraced after abandoning <fen>Option_1</fen>.
<ex>The heroine <t>waffled</t> from one plan <fex name="op2">to another</fex> and all of them were way out in "left field".</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>In the cases where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> does not act on their choice, the <fen>Duration</fen> denotes the length of time from the beginning of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s deliberations to the end. In situations where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> does act on the <fen>Options</fen>, the <fen>Duration</fen> denotes the length of the interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> repeatly changes from one option to the other.
<ex>Jack <t>wavered</t> <fex name="dur">for about six months</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the number of times within a given period that the Cognizer wavers. </def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: waver.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be unable to firmly settle on one of several options

lexUnit.name: vacillate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: waver between different opinions or actions.

lexUnit.name: waffle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fail to make up one's mind.

lexUnit.name: flip-flop.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make an abrupt reversal of policy.
